TopicTitle: Creating your own Kerbals without Kerbalizer?

Articles.Content:
OK, so, All I want to do is rename one of my kerbals to "Wafle R. Kerman", Is it possible and how?!

I will most likely order Kerbalizer soon, so if it's not possible i'll just wait till I get Kerbalizer.

Kerbalizer doesn't change kerbals in game! Don't buy it if that is what you want it for. 

You can rename kerbals in the save game file. Just find the kerbal and change his name then save the file.

There are also several mods that allow you to change names in game. I will post some links when I find the mods again.

To rename your kerbals, just do this:

> 
> You can edit your persistent.sfs in in your KSP folder under \*\saves\(name of your saved game).
> Near the top you'll find this:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > *CREW*
> > *{*
> > 
> > *name = Jebediah Kerman*
> > 
> > *brave = 0.5*
> > 
> > *dumb = 0.5*
> > 
> > *badS = True*
> > 
> > *state = 1*
> > 
> > *ToD = 0*
> > 
> > *idx = 0*
> > 
> > *}*
> 
> 
> Just change the name to whatever you want and save the changes. Next time you load your game his name will have changed.

Also, Kerbalizer does nothing to the actual game itself, it's a completely seperate program as far as I know.

> ![mzl.fngjpjxf.320x480-75.jpg](http://a1070.phobos.apple.com/us/r1000/078/Purple/v4/dc/57/10/dc571060-2abc-3423-2f94-e6832460f68b/mzl.fngjpjxf.320x480-75.jpg)

EDIT: If you want to change how kerbals look in-game, look into [Texture Replacer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107471-0-90-TextureReplacer-2-1-2-new-thread-the-old-one-is-broken), a mod.

oops
While changing the name in persistent.sfs is easy, doesn't it also change the 'profession' thingy in career mode (that I don't use, which is why I don't know)?

Make sure you are in KSP's main menu when you do it. Edit the persistence.sfs with a plain text editor (like notepad, as Norpo suggests). Also, make sure there are no empty lines when you are done editing (i.e. don't put extra returns around a new kerbal entry.) Make the name edit, *then* go start the game. If you reload any quicksaves, the name will go away.

Also, do not rename any kerbals that have scored records, such as first to orbit. If they have entries in the Progress Tracker or in the Contracts section, you will cause the game to crash. Your best bet would be to edit one of the Applicants, then hire him after starting your game.

Cheers,

Also, make sure there are no empty lines when you are done editing (i.e. don't put extra returns around a new kerbal entry.) Make the name edit, *then* go start the game. If you reload any quicksaves, the name will go away.

Alternatively, you can stay inside the current game, make a quicksave, change the desired kerbal's name in the quicksave.sfs file, and quickload. The persistent.sfs file will automatically update itself to the loaded quickload.

Disclaimer: I do not guarantee it won't break your game, just stating it works in mine. Always make a backup of your save before messing with the files.
